description: Refactor ralph.sh to accept named command-line flags for prompt file and max iterations

userStories.title: Parse named command-line flags
userStories.description: As a user, I want to use named flags so the script is self-documenting and argument order doesn't matter.
acceptanceCriteria: Script accepts --prompt <file> flag for prompt file path
Script accepts --max-iterations <n> flag for iteration count
Flags can be provided in any order
Script runs successfully with no flags (uses defaults)
Validate max-iterations is a positive integer

userStories.title: Custom prompt file support with path validation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to specify a custom prompt file so I can run Ralph for different tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: Script exits with error code 1 if specified file doesn't exist
Error message clearly states which file was not found
Default prompt.md (in script directory) used when flag omitted

userStories.title: Add help flag
userStories.description: As a user, I want a help flag so I can see available options.
acceptanceCriteria: Help shows all available flags with descriptions

userStories.title: Update README documentation
userStories.description: As a user, I want updated documentation so I know how to use the new CLI flags.
acceptanceCriteria: README.md includes usage section with all CLI flags
AGENTS.md updated if it references ralph.sh usage
